subject: RE: [junit] Testing philosophy question
msgSnippet: ... I like that. As many assertions as it takes to prove one behaviour. ... Except when they re not. ;-) ... Simon
messageBody:
>> Ok, so what is a test? Is a test an assertEquals() method
>call or is it
>> a testXXX() method?
>
>A test is an assertion that might fail independently of other
>assertions.
>
>If a group of assertions is needed to show that a behavior is correct,
>such making sure a stack actually tracks all its elements,
>then that is
>one test.

I like that. As many assertions as it takes to prove one behaviour.

><opinion>Most of the time, each assertion is a test.</opinion>

Except when they're not. ;-)

>J. B. Rainsberger,

Simon
